_source.text: 9) Rusty Staub - less defense than Beckley, a couple better seasons with the bat 10) Reggie Smith - I like him better than Wynn because he lasted a little longer 11) Tony Perez - very good glove, Beckley is Perez after smoothing 12) Tommy Bridges - best available war era pitcher and we're short war era pitching 13) Virgil Trucks - significant relief innings pitched, if you're evaluating based on some in-season durablity criteria his relief work will mess that up.

text: 9) Rusty Staub - less defense than Beckley, a couple better seasons with the bat 10) **Reggie** **Smith** - I
like him **better** **than** Wynn because he lasted a little longer 11) Tony Perez - very good glove
, Beckley is Perez after smoothing 12) **Tommy** **Bridges** - best available war era pitcher and we're short war
